subject: Writing
title: Cervantes and the Birth of the Novel
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cervantes and the Birth of the Novel.

hook.text: A broke, one-handed ex-soldier wrote a book about a delusional knight. It invented the modern novel.

buildup.text: Miguel de Cervantes published Don Quixote in 1605 while living in poverty in Spain.

discovery.text: The novel mixed comedy, social critique, and psychological depth in ways no story had before.

twist.text: A fake sequel by another author appeared in 1614, forcing Cervantes to write a real Part Two.

climax.text: Don Quixote became the most translated book after the Bible, shaping all fiction that followed.

punchline.text: Literature's greatest hero was a madman on a horse.

quiz.question: When was Don Quixote first published?
